intro: Cyrtandra waioliensis, commonly known as the Waioliensis Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded forest habitats, often growing on rocky or clay soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
